Javier Blesa Martínez
My name is Javier Blesa. I have a PhD in Telecommunication Engineering and I love electronics.
  • javierblesam@gmail.com
  • Linkedin
  • Twitter
  • Github
  • Blog

Javier Blesa Martinez joined the research group of Integrated Systems Laboratory, Department of Electronic Engineering in 2007 for his final project focused on smart environments and sensor networks with low consumption.

In 2008, he completed his final project with the highest rating (distinction) and began to study the Master in Electronic Systems for Intelligent Environments. In 2009 finished the master with the top rating (distinction). In 2015, he finished is PhD degree in the Universidad Politécnica de Madrid with a rating Summa Cum Laudem.

From late 2009 until today has developed a research project focused on the thesis topic, security in cognitive wireless sensor networks, which has resulted in publications and participation in research projects summarized in the following table:

Doctor of Philosiphy (PhD): "Cognitive Strategies for security in Wireless Sensor Networks"

November 2015

Keywords: Cognitive Radio, Security, Wireless Sensor Networks Universidad Politécnica de Madrid, Spain

Master in Electronic Systems for Intelligent Environments.

September 2009

Keywords: Intelligent Environments, IoT, Wireless Sensor Networks, Embedded Systems Universidad Politécnica de Madrid, Spain

Telecommunication Engineer

September 2008

Keywords: Electronic, Wireless Sensor Networks, Embedded Systems Universidad Politécnica de Madrid, Spain

Senior R&D Engineer at B105 Electronic Systems Lab.

January 2007 – currently

9 years of development experience. Drafting, development and management of national and European R&D projects in consortiums of companies. Participation in multiple projects in diferent areas: WSN monitoring, Android, vehicular networks, construction.

Development of the final project titled “Analysis and design of applications for the management of singular buildings based on the ZigBee protocol for wireless personal area networks”. Development of my master thesis titled “Modular architecture for the development of secure networks based on wireless personal area on Intelligent Environments”.

Research work published in multiple JCRs and international congress: 9 JCRs and 19 internationa congress

Teaching at Universidad Politécnica de Madrid: degree and post-graduate.

Developer for Telefónica I+D (Telefónica R&D)

August 2006 – January 2007

Tools division and online access services and customer networks from Telefónica I + D. Testing for network equipment installation kits and new equipment approved for home networking.

  • 3D SHEET study of the feasibility of appearance inspection systems applied to car manufacturing

    Participants: PSA, UPM

  • EASYSAFE - : Early warning system for road safety.

    Participants: VALORIZA, UPM

  • CARRETERAS - Desing and development of a prototype in order to recognize the road conditions.

    Participants: Valoriza, UPM

  • LINEO – Personnel locatization system based on interactive technologies for site environments.

    Participants: Dragados, Sice, UPM, UPV

  • PUENTES – Low cost bridge health monitoring by ambient vibration tests using wireless sensors.

    Participants: KUL Leuven, Uxama, FCC, UPM

JCR

J. Blesa, A. Araujo, E. Romero, and O. Nieto-Taladriz, “Evaluation, Energy Optimization, and Spectrum Analysis of an Artificial Noise Technique to Improve CWSN Security,” International Journal of Distributed Sensor Networks, vol. 2013, pp. 1-8, 2013.

J. Blesa, E. Romero, A. Rozas, A. Araujo, and O. Nieto-Taladriz, “PUE Attack Detection in CWSN Using Collaboration and Learning Behavior,” International Journal of Distributed Sensor Networks, vol. 2013, pp. 1-8, 2013.

J. Blesa, E. Romero, A. Rozas, and A. Araujo, “PUE attack detection in CWSNs using anomaly detection techniques,” EURASIP Journal on Wireless Communications and Networking, vol. 2013, iss. 1, pp. 1-13, 2013.

E. Romero, J. Blesa, A. Rozas, and A. Araujo, “Energy Efficiency Strategy in D2D Cognitive Networks Using Channel Selection Based on Game Theory and Collaboration,” International Journal of Distributed Sensor Networks, vol. 12, pp. 1-14, 2016.

E. Romero, J. Blesa, A. Araujo, and O. Nieto-Taladriz, “A Game Theory Based Strategy for Reducing Energy Consumption in Cognitive WSN,” International Journal of Distributed Sensor Networks, vol. 2014, pp. 1-9, 2014.

E. Romero, J. Blesa, A. Tena, G. Jara, J. Domingo, and A. Araujo, “Cognitive test-bed for wireless sensor networks,” in 2014 IEEE International Symposium on Dynamic Spectrum Access Networks (DYSPAN 2014), 2014, pp. 346-349.

International congress

R. Utrilla, A. Rozas, J. Blesa, and A. Araujo, “A Hybrid Approach to Enhance Cognitive Wireless Sensor Networks with Energy-Efficient Software-Defined Radio Capabilities,” in 2017 International Conference on Embedded Wireless Systems and Networks (EWSN 2017), 2017, pp. 294-299

A. Rozas, J. Blesa, E. Romero, and A. Araujo, “Controlling the degradation of Wireless Sensor Networks,” in 2015 International Wireless Communications and Mobile Computing Conference (IWCMC 2015), 2015, pp. 1217-1223.

J. Blesa, E. Romero, J. C. Vallejo, D. Villanueva, and A. Araujo, “A Cognitive Simulator for Wireless Sensor Networks,” in 5th International Symposium of Ubiquitous Computing and Ambient Intelligence (UCAMI ’11), 2011, pp. 21-32.
